IRS990.MissionDesc: AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM WILL MAKE A MEANINGFUL DIFFERENCE IN THE HEALTH OF SOUTHWEST COLORADO RESIDENTS BY INTEGRATING ALL ASPECTS OF HEALTHCARE AND TREATING THE WHOLE PERSON.
IRS990.Desc: BEHAVIORAL HEALTH OUTPATIENT SERVICES - MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT SERVICES ARE DESIGNED AND DELIVERED IN A MODEL THAT IS SHORT-TERM, PROBLEM FOCUSED AND INCORPORATES THE RECOVERY PERSPECTIVE. TRADITIONAL MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES DESIGNED FOR TREATING DEPRESSION, OBSESSIONS, COMPULSIONS, TRAUMA, GRIEF AND LIFE STRESS ARE AVAILABLE. IN ADDITION, SPECIALTY EXPERTISE FOR THE TREATMENT OF SERIOUS, EMOTIONAL DISTURBANCES OF CHILDHOOD AND SERIOUS AND PERSISTENT MENTAL ILLNESS IN ADULTS; INCLUDING SCHIZOPHRENIA, BIPOLAR DISORDER AND MAJOR DEPRESSION. EVIDENCED BASED PRACTICES AND PROMISING PRACTICES ARE UTILIZED TO ENSURE MAXIMUM EFFECTIVENESS OF THE CARE DELIVERY AND INCLUDE: DIALECTICAL BEHAVIORAL THERAPY, PARENT CHILD INTERACTION THERAPIES AND INTEGRATED DUAL DIAGNOSIS THERAPY. PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES INCLUDING MEDICATION MANAGEMENT ARE ALSO PROVIDED. SERVICE DELIVERY MODALITIES INCLUDE INDIVIDUAL, FAMILY AND GROUP THERAPY, AS WELL AS CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES DESIGNED TO SUPPORT BOTH MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE TREATMENT, PROVIDING A FULL CONTIUUM OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE. A TOTAL OF 66,881 BEHAVIORAL HEALTH OUTPATIENT SERVICE HOURS WERE PROVIDED IN FISCAL YEAR 2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: INTEGRATED PRIMARY CARE - INTEGRATED CARE SERVICES TREATING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND PHYSICAL HEALTH NEEDS OF PATIENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR AHS PATIENTS AT THE LA PLATA INTEGRATED HEALTHCARE CLINIC, CORTEZ INTEGRATED HEALTHCARE CLINIC, ARCHULETA INTEGRATED HEALTHCARE CLINIC, AND TWO SCHOOL BASED HEALTH CENTERS THAT AHS OPERATES IN THE REGION. BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES ARE INTEGRATED INTO THE TRADITIONAL PRIMARY CARE SERVICES THROUGH A CARE TEAM APPROACH THAT USES POPULATION-BASED SCREENINGS FOR NEW PATIENTS WHEN ENROLLING IN THE CLINICS FOR SERVICES. ORAL HEALTH SERVICES ARE PART OF THE INTEGRATED PRIMARY CARE AND ARE OFFERED AT LA PLATA INTEGRATED HEALTHCARE CLINIC AND AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM ORAL HEALTH CLINIC. A TOTAL OF 14,954 INTEGRATED SERVICE HOURS WERE PROVIDED TO PATIENTS IN FISCAL 2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ACUTE TREATMENT UNIT - A 15 BED RESIDENTIAL ACUTE TREATMENT UNIT, PROVIDING SHORT-TERM PSYCHIATRIC CARE AND STABILIZATION IN A THERAPEUTICALLY DESIGNED AND PROFESSIONALLY STAFFED ENVIRONMENT. THE ATU SERVICE DELIVERY COVERS CRISIS MANAGEMENT AND STABILIZATION SERVICES, AT AN INTENSIVE LEVEL THAT ARE NOT APPROPRIATE ON AN OUTPATIENT BASIS. IT IS THE ONLY PSYCHIATRIC RESIDENTIAL RESOURCE AVAILABLE IN THE ENTIRE SOUTHWEST REGION OF COLORADO. THE ATU PROVIDED 1,309 BED DAYS TO 239 RESIDENTS OF THE REGION IN FISCAL YEAR 2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: OTHER - OTHER PROGRAM SERVICE IS LARGELY THE DETOX. AHS OPERATES A 24/7 SOCIAL DETOX UNIT AS A COMPLIMENT AND ENTRY POINT FOR OTHER OUTPATIENT SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER TREATMENT. THE DETOX ALLOWS FOR SHORT-TERM MONITORING OF PATIENTS WHO ARE WITHDRAWING FROM ALCOHOL AND/OR DRUG INTOXICATION OR DEPENDENCY. REFERRALS ARE MADE FOR OUTPATIENT SUBSTANCE SERVICES AND OUT-OF-REGION RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT, AS APPROPRIATE. COURT MANDATED DRUG AND ALCOHOL MONITORING SERVICES ARE ALSO AVAILABLE TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THIS FACILITY. THE DETOX ALSO CAN SERVE AS HOLDING FACILITY FOR PATIENTS ON AN EMERGENCY COMMITMENT (UP TO 5 DAYS) WITH A DISCHARGE REFERRAL TO VOLUNTARY TREATMENT ON A LIMITED INVOLUNTARY COMMITMENT BASIS, FOR PATIENTS AWAITING COURT ORDERED, LONG TERM TREATMENT. IN FISCAL YEAR 2018, THE DETOX FACILITY PROVIDED 3,441 BED DAYS OF SERVICE TO 1,481 PATIENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM HAS APPROXIMATELY 23 CLIENT CUSTODIAL ACCOUNTS. AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM MANAGES THESE CLIENT FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION REGULATIONS.

THE ORGANIZATION IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE) AND IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES ON RELATED INCOME PURSUANT TO SECTION 501(A) OF THE CODE. THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE HAS ESTABLISHED STANDARDS TO BE MET TO MAINTAIN THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX EXEMPT STATUS. IN GENERAL, SUCH STANDARDS REQUIRE THE ORGANIZATION TO MEET A COMMUNITY BENEFITS STANDARD AND COMPLY WITH VARIOUS LAWS AND REGULATIONS. THE ORGANIZATION ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAINTIES IN ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAX ASSETS AND LIABILITIES USING GUIDANCE INCLUDED IN FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD (FASB) ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION (ASC) 740, INCOME TAXES. THE ORGANIZATION RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT OF BEING SUSTAINED. AT JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE ORGANIZATION HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS ACCRUED.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: FIRST AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM INTEGRATED CARE GRANT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM PROVIDES REIMBURSEMENT TO ALL EMPLOYEES FOR HEALTH CLUB MEMBERSHIP OR OTHER PHYSICAL ACTIVITY EQUIPMENT. THE TOTAL REIMBURSEMENT IS LIMITED TO $250 PER EMPLOYEE PER YEAR. THIS IS A PROGRAM TO PROMOTE WELLNESS AMONG EMPLOYEES AT AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM AND THE REIMBURSEMENT IS INCLUDED IN THEIR TAXABLE WAGES.

BERNARD HEATH, JR. PARTICIPATES IN A DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. THE PLAN IS A NONQUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF CODE SECTION 457(F). THE PLAN PROVIDES FOR PAYMENTS UPON RETIREMENT FROM AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM AT A DATE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR A SEPARATION FROM SERVICE DUE TO DEATH OR DISABILITY. DURING FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM CONTRIBUTED $15,000 TO THE PLAN.

AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM (AHS) PROVIDES A WIDE VARIETY OF HEALTHCARE SERVICES SUPPORTING THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITIES IN THE REGION. AHS IS THE DESIGNATED COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER, AND A LICENSED SUBSTANCE USE COUNSELING AND INTERVENTION PROVIDER. THREE OF THE NINE SITES ARE UNDER THE AHS HRSA SECTION 330 STATUS AND OPERATE AS COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS (OR FQHCS) WHICH PROVIDE INTEGRATED PRIMARY CARE INCLUDING ORAL HEALTH CARE. AHS OFFERS A WIDE VARIETY AND RANGE OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND INTEGRATED PRIMARY CARE AND ORAL HEALTH SERVICES TO ASSIST PEOPLE IN MANAGING THEIR HEALTH AND HEALTH OUTCOMES ACROSS THE COUNTIES OF: LA PLATA, ARCHULETA, MONTEZUMA, SAN JUAN AND DOLORES. BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE ACROSS AGES AND INCLUDE FAMILY SERVICES DESIGNED TO BEST MEET THE MENTAL HEALTH, SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND VOCATIONAL NEEDS OF RESIDENTS. ESSENTIAL BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES PROVIDED FOR INCLUDE: SCREENINGS, INDIVIDUAL, GROUP AND FAMILY THERAPEUTIC SERVICES, COMMUNITY RESOURCE COORDINATION, SENIOR OUTREACH, SHORT-TERM RESIDENTIAL CRISIS STABILIZATION, PSYCHIATRIC EVALUATIONS AND MEDICATION MANAGEMENT, 24/7 CRISIS ASSESSMENT SERVICES, SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER EDUCATION, EVALUATIONS AND THERAPY, AS WELL AS DUAL DIAGNOSIS SERVICES FOR PATIENTS WITH CO-OCCURRING MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS. THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICE DELIVERY CONTINUUM ALSO COVERS VOCATIONAL SERVICES INCLUDING: JOB PREPAREDNESS, COACHING, JOB READINESS ASSESSMENT, PLACEMENT AND MONITORING. PRIMARY CARE INTEGRATION SERVICES THAT INCLUDE BEHAVIORAL AND ORAL HEALTH ARE ALSO AVAILABLE ACROSS ALL AGES AND ARE DESIGNED TO TAKE A POPULATION BASED SCREENING APPROACH TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE PRIMARY CARE DESIGNED TO SUPPORT WHOLE PERSON HEALTHCARE THAT INCLUDES SCREENING FOR DEPRESSION, ANXIETY AND SUBSTANCE USE AS PART OF THE PRIMARY CARE STANDARDS OF CARE. ACCESS TO HIGHER LEVELS OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES AND PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE CARE TEAM APPROACH WITHIN THE INTEGRATED CLINICS.
IN OCTOBER OF 2017, AHS OPENED ARCHULETA INTEGRATED HEALTHCARE IN ARCHULETA COUNTY AS A PART OF ITS CONTINUUM OF INTEGRATED PRIMARY CARE SERVICE LOCATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY THE AUDIT FIRM BASED ON THE AUDITED FINANCIALS AND SCHEDULES PREPARED BY AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM ACCOUNTING STAFF. THE APPROVED FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE BUDGET AND FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, APPROVED AND SIGNED BY THE CFO. THE FORM 990 IS FILED BY THE ESTABLISHED DEADLINE EACH YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL STAFF SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT AS PART OF THEIR INITIAL ORIENTATION. A REMINDER NOTICE REGARDING THE TENETS OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS SHARED WITH ALL STAFF ANNUALLY, WITH GUIDANCE ON NOTIFYING AXIS HEALTH SYSTEM OF ANY CHANGE IN STATUS. THE STAFF ARE EXPECTED TO RAISE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST ISSUES FOR ASSESSMENT BY THE CEO OR DESIGNEE. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND A RELATED SECTION (SECTION 10) IN THE BOARD BYLAWS THAT IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY WITH CURRENT BOARD MEMBERS. AT EACH BOARD MEETING, MEMBERS ARE ASKED TO RAISE ANY REAL OR PERCEIVED CONFLICT OF INTEREST ISSUES FOR ASSESSMENT AND RESOLUTION BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR ALL JOB CLASSIFICATIONS, INCLUDING EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT, IS REVIEWED AGAINST THE MENTAL HEALTH COMPENSATION SURVEY FOR COLORADO PREPARED ANNUALLY BY MOUNTAIN STATES EMPLOYERS COUNCIL, INC. (MSEC), AN INDEPENDENT RESOURCE. COMPENSATION INFORMATION IS ALSO OBTAINED FROM ALL COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTERS AND FQHCS IN THE STATE TO ENSURE A VALID ASSESSMENT IS MADE. IN ADDITION, THE CEO COMPENSATION IS SUBJECT TO ADDITIONAL ANNUAL REVIEW BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FROM THE ORGANIZATION UPON REQUEST.

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ASSUMES THE RESPONSIBILTY FOR SELECTING THE INDEPENDENT AUDITORS. THEY ARE ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING THE AUDIT IS COMPLETE. THE BOARD DIRECTS THE CEO TO ENSURE TIMELY COMPLETION OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR REGULAR BOARD REVIEW AND THE PERFORMANCE OF THE ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE CEO DIRECTS/DELEGATES THIS FUNCTION TO THE CFO. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEARS.
